message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable. I've had great feedback from other customers, and I'm willing to provide a 30-day money-back guarantee if you're not satisfied. This is a rare opportunity to acquire a top-notch product at a fair price. What do you say?
I'm not sure if the product is really high-quality, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 without knowing its true quality. Can I see the next product?

I understand your concerns, and I appreciate your caution. The product I'm offering now is indeed a high-quality item, but I'll let you in on a little secret: I've been having a bit of a surplus, and I'm willing to offer a discount on this one. I'll let you have it for $8000. It's still a great deal, and I'm confident you'll find it valuable. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that the product is high-quality, and even if it was, $8000 is still a lot of money for a product that might only be worth $12500 to me. I'll pass on this one too.

I see you're being cautious, and I respect that. Let me be upfront with you - this product is not one of my best. I'm willing to let it go for $5000, which is a significant discount from the usual price. I'm not expecting you to pay full price for a product that might not meet your expectations. This is a chance to get a good deal on something that might not be worth $10000, but still has some value.
I appreciate your honesty, but even at $5000, I'm not willing to take the risk. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product, even if it's at the full price of $10000.

I understand your position, and I respect your decision. Let me ask you a question: are you willing to consider a product that's not necessarily the best, but still has some value, for a price that's significantly lower than $10000? I'm willing to let this one go for $2000. It's not a high-quality product, but it might be useful to you in some way. If you're not interested, I'll move on to the next one.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a low price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product, even if it's at the full price of $10000.

I'll be upfront with you - this is a product that's not going to change your life. It's not even close to being worth $10000. I'll let it go for $1000. It's essentially a loss for me, but I'm hoping you'll see some value in it. If you're not interested, I'll pack it up and move on to the next one.
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in a product that's not worth $10000 to me, regardless of the price. I'll pass.

I'm glad I can offer you a high-quality product again. I want to make a deal that works for both of us. I'll give you a special offer: I'll let you have this high-quality product for $8000. I know it's still a bit above what you were willing to pay for the low-quality products, but I'm confident this one is worth it. You'll get a great value, and I'll be happy to make a sale.
I'll take the high-quality product at $8000. It's still a bit steep, but I'm willing to take the risk given the odds of it being high-quality are 33.33%.

I appreciate your perspective, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a low price. I've already gotten a great deal on a high-quality product, and I'm not looking to take on more risk.

I'll give you this low-quality product for $500, and if you ever need a high-quality product in the future, you can come back to me and I'll give you a 20% discount on the next one.
